thread.title: Gurgaon sees 50 new dengue cases in last 10 days
thread.title_full: Gurgaon sees 50 new dengue cases in last 10 days - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Gurgaon sees 50 new dengue cases in last 10 days
text:
GURGAON: At least 50 cases of dengue have been reported in the city in the last 10 days, taking the official figure to 333 so far.
The district administration on Friday said most patients belong to the 18-55 age group and the maximum number of cases have been reported from new Gurgaon sectors, followed by Farrukhnagar and Wazirabad. Doctors, however, say the actual number could be several times higher.
The number of cases has gone up 20% from last week. The officials have blamed last week's brief spell of rain for the sudden spurt in Dengue cases. "There has been an increase in cases due to the rain a few days ago. Dengue mosquitoes easily breed in fresh rain water. However, we have been able to avoid any casualty this time because of the active role played by our team and the media in spreading awareness. In most of the cases, we have been able to treat the patients," said deputy civil surgeon Dr VK Thapar, Civil Hospital.
Some doctors, however, differed with the assessment of the district administration and claimed that poor reporting mechanism followed by the authorities is responsible for old cases being recorded as fresh ones. "These are cases which were reported in September. Due to extremely slow and poor reporting mechanism, the district health authorities have acknowledged the cases now," said Dr Sandhya Pandey. Dr Rajesh Kumar from Paras Hospital said, "The number of cases is expected to come down by the end of autumn."
